texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Application of this Act
texts.text: Application of this Act

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. (1) This Act applies to all public interest data and all holders of public interest data.
texts.text: (1) This Act applies to all public interest data and all holders of public interest data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Without limiting subsection (1), this Act applies to:
texts.text: Without limiting subsection (1), this Act applies to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  all public sector institutions, including ministries, departments, agencies, and statutory bodies, that collect, generate, process, store or hold public interest data;
texts.text: (a)  all public sector institutions, including ministries, departments, agencies, and statutory bodies, that collect, generate, process, store or hold public interest data;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  all private sector entities that generate, collect, store, or otherwise control or process public interest data in connection with a public function, a regulatory obligation, or the provision of goods or services;
texts.text: (b)  all private sector entities that generate, collect, store, or otherwise control or process public interest data in connection with a public function, a regulatory obligation, or the provision of goods or services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  any  person  or  institution  granted  access  to  the  National  Data  Exchange Platform under this Act; and
texts.text: (c)  any  person  or  institution  granted  access  to  the  National  Data  Exchange Platform under this Act; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  any category of persons whom the Minister shall designate.
texts.text: (d)  any category of persons whom the Minister shall designate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  This Act shall not compel the mandatory sharing of any information classified as restricted  data,  or  any  other  information  whose  disclosure  would  endanger national security, defence, or public safety.
texts.text: This Act shall not compel the mandatory sharing of any information classified as restricted  data,  or  any  other  information  whose  disclosure  would  endanger national security, defence, or public safety.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Objectives of the Act
texts.text: Objectives of the Act

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  purpose  of  this Act  is  to  establish  a  legal  and  institutional  framework  for  the harmonisation,  sharing  and  use  of  public  interest  data,  through  a  secure  data exchange  infrastructure,  to support  efficient public  administration  and  national development. The objectives of this Act are to:
texts.text: The  purpose  of  this Act  is  to  establish  a  legal  and  institutional  framework  for  the harmonisation,  sharing  and  use  of  public  interest  data,  through  a  secure  data exchange  infrastructure,  to support  efficient public  administration  and  national development. The objectives of this Act are to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  promote  coordinated  and  harmonised  data  governance  across  public  and private institutions;
texts.text: (a)  promote  coordinated  and  harmonised  data  governance  across  public  and private institutions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  improve the quality, accessibility,  interconnectedness and interoperability of public interest data;
texts.text: (b)  improve the quality, accessibility,  interconnectedness and interoperability of public interest data;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  provide the legal mandate for the sharing of public interest data;
texts.text: (c)  provide the legal mandate for the sharing of public interest data;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  enable the lawful and secure sharing of public interest data across institutional and sectoral boundaries;
texts.text: (d)  enable the lawful and secure sharing of public interest data across institutional and sectoral boundaries;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  support innovation, competition, research, and evidence-based policy making by enabling lawful access to public interest data;
texts.text: (e)  support innovation, competition, research, and evidence-based policy making by enabling lawful access to public interest data;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  protect the public from fraud, misinformation, and other risks arising from poor data management and fragmented information systems; and
texts.text: (f)  protect the public from fraud, misinformation, and other risks arising from poor data management and fragmented information systems; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g)  ensure  that  public  interest  data  is  governed  in  accordance  with  national values, applicable standards, and international best practices.
texts.text: (g)  ensure  that  public  interest  data  is  governed  in  accordance  with  national values, applicable standards, and international best practices.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: AN ACT to promote data harmonisation, standardisation and exchange to enhance data governance, enable efficient public service delivery, and safeguard data rights and to provide for related matters.
texts.text: AN ACT to promote data harmonisation, standardisation and exchange to enhance data governance, enable efficient public service delivery, and safeguard data rights and to provide for related matters.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Guiding Principles
texts.text: Guiding Principles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The implementation of this Act shall be guided by the following principles:
texts.text: The implementation of this Act shall be guided by the following principles:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  data integrity, public interest data must be consistent, accurate and reliable;
texts.text: (a)  data integrity, public interest data must be consistent, accurate and reliable;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  data  standardisation,  there  must  be  common  formats,  definitions  and classifications used across databases to enable exchange of information and comparability;
texts.text: (b)  data  standardisation,  there  must  be  common  formats,  definitions  and classifications used across databases to enable exchange of information and comparability;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  data  democratisation,  public  interest  data  must  be  accessible  and  readily available for use across sectors;
texts.text: (c)  data  democratisation,  public  interest  data  must  be  accessible  and  readily available for use across sectors;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  interoperability, systems and institutions must be able to interpret, use, and exchange data seamlessly through the appropriate standards and protocols;
texts.text: (d)  interoperability, systems and institutions must be able to interpret, use, and exchange data seamlessly through the appropriate standards and protocols;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  reusability, redundant data collection must be avoided; where applicable, the same data should be collected once only and re-used appropriately across institutions;
texts.text: (e)  reusability, redundant data collection must be avoided; where applicable, the same data should be collected once only and re-used appropriately across institutions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  security, access to public interest data should be as open as possible, but as closed  as  necessary;  the  right  to  access  data  must  be  balanced  with  the privacy and safety of citizens and the security of the Republic;
texts.text: (f)  security, access to public interest data should be as open as possible, but as closed  as  necessary;  the  right  to  access  data  must  be  balanced  with  the privacy and safety of citizens and the security of the Republic;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g)  optimisation, data sharing and system integration should support the delivery of timely, efficient and citizen-centred public services; and
texts.text: (g)  optimisation, data sharing and system integration should support the delivery of timely, efficient and citizen-centred public services; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h)  transparency, the collection, access and use of public interest data should be forthright and promote accountability and public trust.
texts.text: (h)  transparency, the collection, access and use of public interest data should be forthright and promote accountability and public trust.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Sharing and the National Data Exchange Platform
texts.text: Data Sharing and the National Data Exchange Platform

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of the National Data Exchange Platform
texts.text: Establishment of the National Data Exchange Platform

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. (1) There is established by this Act the  National Data Exchange Platform, a public digital infrastructure for the secure, standardised and interoperable exchange of public interest data.
texts.text: (1) There is established by this Act the  National Data Exchange Platform, a public digital infrastructure for the secure, standardised and interoperable exchange of public interest data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  National  Data  Exchange  Platform  shall  operate  as  the  central  national infrastructure for the provision and exchange of public interest data held by public institutions  and  eligible  private  entities,  specifically  comprising  open  data  and shareable data.
texts.text: The  National  Data  Exchange  Platform  shall  operate  as  the  central  national infrastructure for the provision and exchange of public interest data held by public institutions  and  eligible  private  entities,  specifically  comprising  open  data  and shareable data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The National Data Exchange Platform shall:
texts.text: The National Data Exchange Platform shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)   facilitate the lawful sharing, exchange and re-use of public interest data in accordance with this Act;
texts.text: (a)   facilitate the lawful sharing, exchange and re-use of public interest data in accordance with this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  support machine-readable access to public interest data through standardised APIs and related technologies;
texts.text: (b)  support machine-readable access to public interest data through standardised APIs and related technologies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  support accessibility to public interest data  and  the  interoperability  of databases;
texts.text: (c)  support accessibility to public interest data  and  the  interoperability  of databases;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  facilitate the onboarding of data providers and data consumers; and
texts.text: (d)  facilitate the onboarding of data providers and data consumers; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  promote transparency in the access and management of public interest data.
texts.text: (e)  promote transparency in the access and management of public interest data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The National Data Exchange Platform shall be held by the Republic through the Ministry.
texts.text: The National Data Exchange Platform shall be held by the Republic through the Ministry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The  technical  operation,  configuration,  administration  and  maintenance  of  the National  Data  Exchange  Platform  shall  be  managed  and  supervised  by  the Authority in accordance with the policy direction and objectives prescribed by the Minister.
texts.text: The  technical  operation,  configuration,  administration  and  maintenance  of  the National  Data  Exchange  Platform  shall  be  managed  and  supervised  by  the Authority in accordance with the policy direction and objectives prescribed by the Minister.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  The installation and day-to-day operations of the National Data Exchange Platform shall at all times be managed by an entity registered under the laws of Ghana and
texts.text: The installation and day-to-day operations of the National Data Exchange Platform shall at all times be managed by an entity registered under the laws of Ghana and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: subject to the local content and local participation requirements prescribed by the Authority.
texts.text: subject to the local content and local participation requirements prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  The Minister may prescribe requirements and procedures for the administration of the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: The Minister may prescribe requirements and procedures for the administration of the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Sharing Obligations
texts.text: Data Sharing Obligations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. (1) All holders of public interest data shall identify and classify the public interest data they hold as either open data, shareable data or restricted data in accordance with Schedule 1 of this Act.
texts.text: (1) All holders of public interest data shall identify and classify the public interest data they hold as either open data, shareable data or restricted data in accordance with Schedule 1 of this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Minister may from time to time prescribe additional classifications of public interest data.
texts.text: The Minister may from time to time prescribe additional classifications of public interest data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)   All open data holders shall provide access to such open data via the National Data Exchange Platform in accordance with this Act and any directives issued under it.
texts.text: All open data holders shall provide access to such open data via the National Data Exchange Platform in accordance with this Act and any directives issued under it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Shareable data holders shall provide access to shareable data via the National Data Exchange Platform upon the fulfilment of the relevant conditions required to access that shareable data.
texts.text: Shareable data holders shall provide access to shareable data via the National Data Exchange Platform upon the fulfilment of the relevant conditions required to access that shareable data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Shareable data holders shall clearly define and make transparent any conditions, procedures or terms which need to be met to access the shareable data.
texts.text: Shareable data holders shall clearly define and make transparent any conditions, procedures or terms which need to be met to access the shareable data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the sharing of data classified as restricted, except as may be authorised under this Act or any other applicable law.
texts.text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the sharing of data classified as restricted, except as may be authorised under this Act or any other applicable law.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  A holder of public interest data who fails to provide access in contravention of this section commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than two hundred penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A holder of public interest data who fails to provide access in contravention of this section commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than two hundred penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Providers
texts.text: Data Providers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. (1) A holder of public interest data may be designated as a data provider under this Act and shall be onboarded onto the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: (1) A holder of public interest data may be designated as a data provider under this Act and shall be onboarded onto the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A person shall qualify as a data provider if that person:
texts.text: A person shall qualify as a data provider if that person:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  is a public body or private entity or institution that holds public interest data; or
texts.text: (a)  is a public body or private entity or institution that holds public interest data; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  performs  a  statutory,  regulatory,  or  public  service  function  involving  the generation or management of public interest data; and
texts.text: (b)  performs  a  statutory,  regulatory,  or  public  service  function  involving  the generation or management of public interest data; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  meets the eligibility criteria prescribed by the Authority.
texts.text: (c)  meets the eligibility criteria prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Without limiting the provisions of subsection (2) above, the Minister may designate entities, bodies, systems, organisations and institutions as data providers.
texts.text: Without limiting the provisions of subsection (2) above, the Minister may designate entities, bodies, systems, organisations and institutions as data providers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Authority  shall,  in  consultation  with  the Advisory  Committee,  prescribe  the criteria  and  procedures  for  determining  eligibility  as  a  data  provider  and  the responsibilities of approved data providers in their operations on the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: The Authority  shall,  in  consultation  with  the Advisory  Committee,  prescribe  the criteria  and  procedures  for  determining  eligibility  as  a  data  provider  and  the responsibilities of approved data providers in their operations on the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The Authority shall issue guidelines on the process and technical requirements for onboarding and integration with the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: The Authority shall issue guidelines on the process and technical requirements for onboarding and integration with the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  A data provider shall:
texts.text: A data provider shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  ensure the accuracy and completeness of their database provided;
texts.text: (a)  ensure the accuracy and completeness of their database provided;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  apply the appropriate classification, specifications and format requirements as prescribed under this Act;
texts.text: (b)  apply the appropriate classification, specifications and format requirements as prescribed under this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  implement appropriate security and technical measures, access controls and data protection measures as required under this Act or any other applicable law; and
texts.text: (c)  implement appropriate security and technical measures, access controls and data protection measures as required under this Act or any other applicable law; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  maintain internal processes to support timely and efficient data exchange in accordance with this Act and any Regulations, directives or guidelines issued under this Act.
texts.text: (d)  maintain internal processes to support timely and efficient data exchange in accordance with this Act and any Regulations, directives or guidelines issued under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7) The Authority shall, in consultation with relevant sector regulators, maintain a register of approved data providers.
texts.text: The Authority shall, in consultation with relevant sector regulators, maintain a register of approved data providers.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Exchange Framework
texts.text: Data Exchange Framework

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. (1)  Data  providers  shall  grant  access  to  their  databases  in  a  file  format  which  is structured,  machine-readable  and  compatible  with  the  National  Data  Exchange Platform to allow software applications to easily identify, recognise and extract specific data.
texts.text: (1)  Data  providers  shall  grant  access  to  their  databases  in  a  file  format  which  is structured,  machine-readable  and  compatible  with  the  National  Data  Exchange Platform to allow software applications to easily identify, recognise and extract specific data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  Authority  shall,  in  consultation  with  the  Advisory  Committee,  prescribe technical and operational standards, including but not limited to:
texts.text: The  Authority  shall,  in  consultation  with  the  Advisory  Committee,  prescribe technical and operational standards, including but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  the use of standardised data formats across all databases;
texts.text: (a)  the use of standardised data formats across all databases;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  the adoption of sector-appropriate data exchange formats, including but not limited to XML and JSON;
texts.text: (b)  the adoption of sector-appropriate data exchange formats, including but not limited to XML and JSON;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  connectivity protocols that ensure secure, real-time, or scheduled data transmission;
texts.text: (c)  connectivity protocols that ensure secure, real-time, or scheduled data transmission;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  the application of sector-specific classification systems, taxonomies, and data dictionaries;
texts.text: (d)  the application of sector-specific classification systems, taxonomies, and data dictionaries;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  the use of unique identifiers across sectors to ensure traceability and data deduplication; and
texts.text: (e)  the use of unique identifiers across sectors to ensure traceability and data deduplication; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  metadata standards, classification levels, and tagging practices for all public interest data.
texts.text: (f)  metadata standards, classification levels, and tagging practices for all public interest data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Authority  shall  prescribe  the  technical  specifications  referenced  under subsection (2) and update them periodically to reflect international best practices and emerging technologies.
texts.text: The  Authority  shall  prescribe  the  technical  specifications  referenced  under subsection (2) and update them periodically to reflect international best practices and emerging technologies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) Where  conversion  of  public  interest  data  into  the  prescribed  digital  format  is impossible  or  would  involve  a  disproportionate  effort,  the  data  provider  shall consult  with  the Authority  to  determine  an  appropriate alternative  prior  to  their onboarding.
texts.text: Where  conversion  of  public  interest  data  into  the  prescribed  digital  format  is impossible  or  would  involve  a  disproportionate  effort,  the  data  provider  shall consult  with  the Authority  to  determine  an  appropriate alternative  prior  to  their onboarding.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: System Integration and API Governance
texts.text: System Integration and API Governance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. (1)  A    data  provider  shall  ensure  that  all  data  sharing  occurs  through  secure, standardised, and auditable APIs, as prescribed by the Authority in consultation with the Ghana Standards Authority.
texts.text: (1)  A    data  provider  shall  ensure  that  all  data  sharing  occurs  through  secure, standardised, and auditable APIs, as prescribed by the Authority in consultation with the Ghana Standards Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Authority shall prescribe technical specifications on:
texts.text: The Authority shall prescribe technical specifications on:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  API architecture, protocols, and endpoints to ensure system-wide interoperability;
texts.text: (a)  API architecture, protocols, and endpoints to ensure system-wide interoperability;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  authentication  and  authorisation  mechanisms,  including  the  use  of  digital credentials, access tokens, and role-based permissions;
texts.text: (b)  authentication  and  authorisation  mechanisms,  including  the  use  of  digital credentials, access tokens, and role-based permissions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  encryption requirements for data in transit and at rest to preserve confidentiality and integrity;
texts.text: (c)  encryption requirements for data in transit and at rest to preserve confidentiality and integrity;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  tracking, logging, and audit mechanisms for each data request and response exchanged via the National Data Exchange Platform;
texts.text: (d)  tracking, logging, and audit mechanisms for each data request and response exchanged via the National Data Exchange Platform;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  implementation  of  tiered  access  or  safeguard  measures  for  sensitive  data requiring limited or controlled disclosure; and
texts.text: (e)  implementation  of  tiered  access  or  safeguard  measures  for  sensitive  data requiring limited or controlled disclosure; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  any other specifications that the Authority may deem relevant.
texts.text: (f)  any other specifications that the Authority may deem relevant.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A  data  provider  shall  comply  with  all  specifications  provided  by  the Authority  in accordance with subsection (2) and shall implement robust internal policies and procedures  to  protect  and  safeguard  access  to  their  API  keys  to prevent unauthorised use.
texts.text: A  data  provider  shall  comply  with  all  specifications  provided  by  the Authority  in accordance with subsection (2) and shall implement robust internal policies and procedures  to  protect  and  safeguard  access  to  their  API  keys  to prevent unauthorised use.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A data provider who intentionally, recklessly or by gross negligence fails to prevent API exposure and unauthorised access is subject to an administrative penalty of up to ten thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A data provider who intentionally, recklessly or by gross negligence fails to prevent API exposure and unauthorised access is subject to an administrative penalty of up to ten thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  A  data  provider  shall  not  expose  or  allow  access  to  any  database  through  the National  Data  Exchange  Platform  unless  the  relevant API  integration  has  been tested and approved by the Authority or a body designated by the Authority.
texts.text: A  data  provider  shall  not  expose  or  allow  access  to  any  database  through  the National  Data  Exchange  Platform  unless  the  relevant API  integration  has  been tested and approved by the Authority or a body designated by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  A data provider who fails to comply with subsection (5) commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A data provider who fails to comply with subsection (5) commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  The Authority  may,  in  addition  to  the  penalty  under  subsection  (6),  impose  an administrative penalty of up to one thousand penalty units.
texts.text: The Authority  may,  in  addition  to  the  penalty  under  subsection  (6),  impose  an administrative penalty of up to one thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (8)  The Authority shall monitor API performance, integrity, and security on a continuous basis,  and  may  issue  technical  updates  or  revoke  access  where  necessary  to ensure compliance with this Act.
texts.text: The Authority shall monitor API performance, integrity, and security on a continuous basis,  and  may  issue  technical  updates  or  revoke  access  where  necessary  to ensure compliance with this Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Security
texts.text: Data Security

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. (1) A data provider shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, security and continuous availability of the public interest data they share through the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: (1) A data provider shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, security and continuous availability of the public interest data they share through the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Without limiting subsection (1) or any other obligations of data providers under this agreement, a data provider shall:
texts.text: Without limiting subsection (1) or any other obligations of data providers under this agreement, a data provider shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  establish  role-based  access  controls  and  user  authentication  protocols  to prevent unauthorised access to the database;
texts.text: (a)  establish  role-based  access  controls  and  user  authentication  protocols  to prevent unauthorised access to the database;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  ensure encryption of data in transit and at rest, using standards prescribed by the Authority;
texts.text: (b)  ensure encryption of data in transit and at rest, using standards prescribed by the Authority;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  maintain routine backup systems for the database;
texts.text: (c)  maintain routine backup systems for the database;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  implement business continuity and disaster recovery measures to minimise disruption in the event of system failure or compromise; and
texts.text: (d)  implement business continuity and disaster recovery measures to minimise disruption in the event of system failure or compromise; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  maintain  internal  controls  and  procedures  for  identifying,  reporting,  and responding to security incidents.
texts.text: (e)  maintain  internal  controls  and  procedures  for  identifying,  reporting,  and responding to security incidents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Authority  may,  in  consultation  with  the  Cyber  Security  Authority,  Data Protection  Commission  and  any  other  relevant  government  agencies,  issue guidelines or directives specifying minimum security standards for data providers and data consumers.
texts.text: The  Authority  may,  in  consultation  with  the  Cyber  Security  Authority,  Data Protection  Commission  and  any  other  relevant  government  agencies,  issue guidelines or directives specifying minimum security standards for data providers and data consumers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)   The  Authority  may  prescribe  different  data  security  benchmarks  for  specific sectors or databases, taking into account the nature, use, and sensitivity of the data.
texts.text: The  Authority  may  prescribe  different  data  security  benchmarks  for  specific sectors or databases, taking into account the nature, use, and sensitivity of the data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) A  data  provider  shall,  upon  request,  furnish  the Authority  with  evidence  of  the internal procedures and systems in place to ensure data security in accordance with this section.
texts.text: A  data  provider  shall,  upon  request,  furnish  the Authority  with  evidence  of  the internal procedures and systems in place to ensure data security in accordance with this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6) A  data  provider  shall  notify  the Authority  promptly  of  any  actual  or  suspected breach, compromise, or unauthorised access affecting  its database, and in any case, no later than within seventy-two (72) hours of discovery:
texts.text: A  data  provider  shall  notify  the Authority  promptly  of  any  actual  or  suspected breach, compromise, or unauthorised access affecting  its database, and in any case, no later than within seventy-two (72) hours of discovery:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  where  the  breach  is  of  a  nature  affecting  personal  data,  then  the  data provider  shall  additionally  notify  the  Data  Protection  Commission  in accordance  with  the  provisions  of  the  [Data  Protection Act  20XX,  (Act XXX)].
texts.text: (a)  where  the  breach  is  of  a  nature  affecting  personal  data,  then  the  data provider  shall  additionally  notify  the  Data  Protection  Commission  in accordance  with  the  provisions  of  the  [Data  Protection Act  20XX,  (Act XXX)].

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  where  the  breach  is  of  a  nature  involving  cybersecurity-related  matters then the data provider shall additionally notify the Cybersecurity Authority within twenty-four (24) hours  of detection in accordance  with the [Cybersecurity Act 20XX, (Act XXX)];
texts.text: (b)  where  the  breach  is  of  a  nature  involving  cybersecurity-related  matters then the data provider shall additionally notify the Cybersecurity Authority within twenty-four (24) hours  of detection in accordance  with the [Cybersecurity Act 20XX, (Act XXX)];

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  The form and manner of notification in subsection (6) and the immediate steps to be implemented after notification shall be prescribed by the Authority.
texts.text: The form and manner of notification in subsection (6) and the immediate steps to be implemented after notification shall be prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (8)  A data provider who fails to comply with this section 9 commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A data provider who fails to comply with this section 9 commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (9) The Authority  may,  in  addition  to  the  penalty  under  subsection  (8),  impose  an administrative penalty of up to ten thousand penalty units.
texts.text: The Authority  may,  in  addition  to  the  penalty  under  subsection  (8),  impose  an administrative penalty of up to ten thousand penalty units.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Quality Requirements
texts.text: Data Quality Requirements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. (1) A data provider shall ensure that all databases made available through the National Data Exchange Platform meet the quality standards prescribed by the Authority.
texts.text: (1) A data provider shall ensure that all databases made available through the National Data Exchange Platform meet the quality standards prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  For the purposes of subsection (1), a data provider shall:
texts.text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a data provider shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  maintain the accuracy and completeness of public interest data contained in its databases;
texts.text: (a)  maintain the accuracy and completeness of public interest data contained in its databases;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  eliminate duplicate records and ensure data consistency across systems;
texts.text: (b)  eliminate duplicate records and ensure data consistency across systems;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  establish procedures for regular updates, corrections, and verification of data entries; and
texts.text: (c)  establish procedures for regular updates, corrections, and verification of data entries; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  where appropriate, implement version control mechanisms to track changes and ensure the integrity of historical records.
texts.text: (d)  where appropriate, implement version control mechanisms to track changes and ensure the integrity of historical records.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Authority may prescribe different data quality benchmarks for specific sectors or categories of data, taking into account the nature, use, and sensitivity of the data.
texts.text: The Authority may prescribe different data quality benchmarks for specific sectors or categories of data, taking into account the nature, use, and sensitivity of the data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) A  data  provider  shall,  upon  request,  furnish  the Authority  with  evidence  of  the internal procedures and systems in place to ensure data quality in accordance with this section.
texts.text: A  data  provider  shall,  upon  request,  furnish  the Authority  with  evidence  of  the internal procedures and systems in place to ensure data quality in accordance with this section.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Audit Trails and Logging
texts.text: Audit Trails and Logging

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11. (1) A data provider shall implement and maintain audit trails and logging mechanisms for  every  access,  transmission,  or  modification  of  public  interest  data  through  the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: (1) A data provider shall implement and maintain audit trails and logging mechanisms for  every  access,  transmission,  or  modification  of  public  interest  data  through  the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The audit trails and logs shall, at a minimum:
texts.text: The audit trails and logs shall, at a minimum:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  record  the  identity of  the data  consumer  or system initiating  the  access  or request;
texts.text: (a)  record  the  identity of  the data  consumer  or system initiating  the  access  or request;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  specify the nature, date, time, and outcome of the transaction;
texts.text: (b)  specify the nature, date, time, and outcome of the transaction;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  indicate  the  database  and  category  or  classification  of  data  accessed  or exchanged; and
texts.text: (c)  indicate  the  database  and  category  or  classification  of  data  accessed  or exchanged; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  capture any anomalies, access failures, or unauthorised attempts.
texts.text: (d)  capture any anomalies, access failures, or unauthorised attempts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) Audit logs shall be:
texts.text: Audit logs shall be:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  securely stored in tamper-evident form;
texts.text: (a)  securely stored in tamper-evident form;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  encrypted and protected from unauthorised access or deletion; and
texts.text: (b)  encrypted and protected from unauthorised access or deletion; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  retained  for  a  minimum  of  five  (5)  years,  or  such  other  period  as  may  be prescribed by the Authority.
texts.text: (c)  retained  for  a  minimum  of  five  (5)  years,  or  such  other  period  as  may  be prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Authority may:
texts.text: The Authority may:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  conduct periodic reviews of audit trails for compliance monitoring or technical assessment;
texts.text: (a)  conduct periodic reviews of audit trails for compliance monitoring or technical assessment;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  require the submission of logs by data providers to support investigations, verify system integrity, or assess suspected misuse; and
texts.text: (b)  require the submission of logs by data providers to support investigations, verify system integrity, or assess suspected misuse; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  issue directives regarding the format, storage, or transmission of audit logs.
texts.text: (c)  issue directives regarding the format, storage, or transmission of audit logs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  A data provider shall establish internal protocols for monitoring and analysing audit trails to detect unusual activity, prevent abuse, and support incident response.
texts.text: A data provider shall establish internal protocols for monitoring and analysing audit trails to detect unusual activity, prevent abuse, and support incident response.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Oversight and Accountability
texts.text: Oversight and Accountability

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12. (1) The Authority shall monitor and enforce compliance with this Act, and may take appropriate enforcement actions against any data provider or data consumer who fails to meet their obligations under this Act.
texts.text: (1) The Authority shall monitor and enforce compliance with this Act, and may take appropriate enforcement actions against any data provider or data consumer who fails to meet their obligations under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) In  carrying  out  its  oversight  function,  the  Authority  shall  issue  guidelines, directives,  and  notices  to  ensure  the  proper  functioning  of  the  National  Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: In  carrying  out  its  oversight  function,  the  Authority  shall  issue  guidelines, directives,  and  notices  to  ensure  the  proper  functioning  of  the  National  Data Exchange Platform.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Authority shall consult the Advisory Committee and other relevant stakeholders in matters of joint oversight or technical coordination.
texts.text: The  Authority shall consult the Advisory Committee and other relevant stakeholders in matters of joint oversight or technical coordination.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A data provider shall submit periodic reports on their performance on the National Data  Exchange  Platform  and  their  compliance  with  this  Act.  The  form  and frequency of the reports shall be determined by the Authority.
texts.text: A data provider shall submit periodic reports on their performance on the National Data  Exchange  Platform  and  their  compliance  with  this  Act.  The  form  and frequency of the reports shall be determined by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The Authority shall publish an annual report detailing performance indicators and other  key  metrics  of  the  National  Data  Exchange  Platform  and  other  relevant information to promote transparency.
texts.text: The Authority shall publish an annual report detailing performance indicators and other  key  metrics  of  the  National  Data  Exchange  Platform  and  other  relevant information to promote transparency.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  Each data provider shall:
texts.text: Each data provider shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  appoint  a  designated  officer  responsible  for  ensuring  compliance  with  the obligations under this Act;
texts.text: (a)  appoint  a  designated  officer  responsible  for  ensuring  compliance  with  the obligations under this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  respond to queries or directives issued by the Authority within the prescribed timelines; and
texts.text: (b)  respond to queries or directives issued by the Authority within the prescribed timelines; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  take corrective actions directed by the Authority promptly where deficiencies are identified.
texts.text: (c)  take corrective actions directed by the Authority promptly where deficiencies are identified.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Governance Framework
texts.text: Governance Framework

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Oversight Authority
texts.text: Oversight Authority

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13. The Authority shall be responsible for overseeing the implementation and enforcement of this Act.
texts.text: The Authority shall be responsible for overseeing the implementation and enforcement of this Act.

texts.orig: Functions of the Authority
texts.text: Functions of the Authority

texts.orig: 14. The functions of the Authority include but are not limited to:
texts.text: The functions of the Authority include but are not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  overseeing the establishment and maintenance of the National Data Exchange Platform;
texts.text: (a)  overseeing the establishment and maintenance of the National Data Exchange Platform;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  ensuring the operational integrity, accessibility and efficiency of the National Data Exchange Platform;
texts.text: (b)  ensuring the operational integrity, accessibility and efficiency of the National Data Exchange Platform;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  overseeing compliance with the provisions of this Act and any subsidiary legislation, regulations, directives, guidelines or notices issued under this Act;
texts.text: (c)  overseeing compliance with the provisions of this Act and any subsidiary legislation, regulations, directives, guidelines or notices issued under this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  developing, issuing and updating technical, operational and security guidelines in consultation with the Advisory Committee;
texts.text: (d)  developing, issuing and updating technical, operational and security guidelines in consultation with the Advisory Committee;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  overseeing the onboarding, registration, and monitoring of data providers and data consumers;
texts.text: (e)  overseeing the onboarding, registration, and monitoring of data providers and data consumers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  maintaining a register of data providers and data consumers connected to the National Data Exchange Platform;
texts.text: (f)  maintaining a register of data providers and data consumers connected to the National Data Exchange Platform;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g)  collaborating with relevant stakeholders to ensure alignment with national policies and frameworks;
texts.text: (g)  collaborating with relevant stakeholders to ensure alignment with national policies and frameworks;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h)  coordinating with other regulatory bodies to ensure alignment with applicable laws, including but not limited to laws on data protection, cybersecurity, standardisation and open banking;
texts.text: (h)  coordinating with other regulatory bodies to ensure alignment with applicable laws, including but not limited to laws on data protection, cybersecurity, standardisation and open banking;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) issuing and enforcing administrative directives, notices or sanctions as provided under this Act;
texts.text: (i) issuing and enforcing administrative directives, notices or sanctions as provided under this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (j) investigating and resolving disputes;
texts.text: (j) investigating and resolving disputes;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (k)  coordinating capacity building, stakeholder engagement, and public education on data harmonisation and the National Data Exchange Platform; and
texts.text: (k)  coordinating capacity building, stakeholder engagement, and public education on data harmonisation and the National Data Exchange Platform; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (l) advising the Minister on policy implementation matters under this Act.
texts.text: (l) advising the Minister on policy implementation matters under this Act.

texts.orig: Data Harmonisation Advisory Committee
texts.text: Data Harmonisation Advisory Committee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15. (1) There is established by this Act a Data Harmonisation Advisory Committee to provide operational insight, discuss cross-sectoral matters on data harmonisation and provide strategic advice to support the Authority in the effective performance of its functions.
texts.text: (1) There is established by this Act a Data Harmonisation Advisory Committee to provide operational insight, discuss cross-sectoral matters on data harmonisation and provide strategic advice to support the Authority in the effective performance of its functions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Committee shall be composed of:
texts.text: The Committee shall be composed of:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the Minister;
texts.text: (a) the Minister;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  a representative of the National Information Technology Agency not below the rank of a director;
texts.text: (b)  a representative of the National Information Technology Agency not below the rank of a director;

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (c) a representative of the Bank of Ghana not below the rank of director;

texts.orig: (d) a representative of the Cyber Security Authority not below the rank of a director;
texts.text: (d) a representative of the Cyber Security Authority not below the rank of a director;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  a representative of the Data Protection Commission not below the rank of a director;
texts.text: (e)  a representative of the Data Protection Commission not below the rank of a director;

texts.orig: (i) a representative of the National Identification Authority not below the rank of a director or its functional equivalent;
texts.text: (i) a representative of the National Identification Authority not below the rank of a director or its functional equivalent;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (j) a senior officer of the [National Intelligence Bureau/National Security Council];
texts.text: (j) a senior officer of the [National Intelligence Bureau/National Security Council];

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (k) a representative of the Office of the Registrar of Companies not below the rank of a director or its functional equivalent;
texts.text: (k) a representative of the Office of the Registrar of Companies not below the rank of a director or its functional equivalent;

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (l) two persons from the private sector with expertise in data management, data architecture, data analysis, standards engineering, ICT or digital services; and

texts.orig: (m)  one representative of civil society with experience in data protection, intellectual property or digital rights.
texts.text: (m)  one representative of civil society with experience in data protection, intellectual property or digital rights.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The members of the Committee shall be appointed by the Minister on the recommendation of the respective institutions and at least three (3) of the representatives shall be women.
texts.text: The members of the Committee shall be appointed by the Minister on the recommendation of the respective institutions and at least three (3) of the representatives shall be women.

texts.text: The Committee shall meet at least once every six months and may hold extraordinary meetings:

texts.text: (a)  strategic direction and long-term planning for data exchange and harmonisation;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Access and Use of the National Data Exchange Platform
texts.text: Access and Use of the National Data Exchange Platform

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Access
texts.text: Data Access

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16. (1) A person approved by the Authority as a data consumer may access public interest data through the National Data Exchange Platform in accordance with this Act.
texts.text: (1) A person approved by the Authority as a data consumer may access public interest data through the National Data Exchange Platform in accordance with this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Access to data on the National Data Exchange Platform shall be granted for the following permitted purposes:
texts.text: Access to data on the National Data Exchange Platform shall be granted for the following permitted purposes:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  delivery of public services or performance of statutory functions;
texts.text: (a)  delivery of public services or performance of statutory functions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  research, innovation, and academic development;
texts.text: (b)  research, innovation, and academic development;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  statistical analysis and evidence-based policymaking;
texts.text: (c)  statistical analysis and evidence-based policymaking;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  detection and prevention of fraud, financial crime or other unlawful conduct;
texts.text: (d)  detection and prevention of fraud, financial crime or other unlawful conduct;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  regulatory compliance, oversight and supervision functions; or
texts.text: (e)  regulatory compliance, oversight and supervision functions; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  any other lawful purposes approved by the Authority in consultation with the Minister.
texts.text: (f)  any other lawful purposes approved by the Authority in consultation with the Minister.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A person seeking approval as a data consumer shall apply to the Authority for authorisation. The application shall be made in a manner prescribed by the Authority and at a minimum, must:
texts.text: A person seeking approval as a data consumer shall apply to the Authority for authorisation. The application shall be made in a manner prescribed by the Authority and at a minimum, must:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  identify the applicant and describe the purpose for which access is required;
texts.text: (a)  identify the applicant and describe the purpose for which access is required;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  specify the public interest data for which access is being requested, including any intended re-use or onward sharing;
texts.text: (b)  specify the public interest data for which access is being requested, including any intended re-use or onward sharing;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  disclose the applicant's legal basis or authorisation for accessing the data, where applicable;

texts.orig: (4)  A person seeking approval as a data consumer shall be a legal entity or body corporate and shall not be a natural person.
texts.text: A person seeking approval as a data consumer shall be a legal entity or body corporate and shall not be a natural person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Upon approval, a data consumer shall be granted access credentials to the National Data Exchange Platform for a period of one (1) year and assigned a data access tier in accordance with their authorisation level.
texts.text: Upon approval, a data consumer shall be granted access credentials to the National Data Exchange Platform for a period of one (1) year and assigned a data access tier in accordance with their authorisation level.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  A data consumer may, upon expiration of their credentials, apply to the Authority for a renewal of their subscription in the prescribed form. The Authority may request additional up-to-date information from the applicant prior to granting a renewal.
texts.text: A data consumer may, upon expiration of their credentials, apply to the Authority for a renewal of their subscription in the prescribed form. The Authority may request additional up-to-date information from the applicant prior to granting a renewal.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  A person who unlawfully or without the proper authorisation accesses databases on the National Data Exchange Platform commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than one hundred thousand penalty units or a term of imprisonment of not more than five years or both.
texts.text: A person who unlawfully or without the proper authorisation accesses databases on the National Data Exchange Platform commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than one hundred thousand penalty units or a term of imprisonment of not more than five years or both.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The Authority may, in addition to the penalty under subsection (7), impose an administrative penalty of up to ten thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Data consumers may be required to enter data use agreements as a precondition to accessing shareable data or restricted data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (10)  Data consumers shall not re-use data obtained through the National Data Exchange Platform in a manner that duplicates or directly competes with the service offered by the data provider whose database they accessed.
texts.text: Data consumers shall not re-use data obtained through the National Data Exchange Platform in a manner that duplicates or directly competes with the service offered by the data provider whose database they accessed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (11)  Data consumers shall not re-use personal data except in a manner that has been consented to by the data subject or is otherwise permitted by law.
texts.text: Data consumers shall not re-use personal data except in a manner that has been consented to by the data subject or is otherwise permitted by law.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (12)  A data consumer that contravenes subsections (10) and (11) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than five thousand penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A data consumer that contravenes subsections (10) and (11) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than five thousand penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: offence and is liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five thousand penalty units and not more than one hundred thousand penalty units or a term of imprisonment of not more than seven years or both.

texts.text: (b) the classification of such data as open, shareable or restricted;

texts.text: The Authority may refuse to grant an application where:

texts.text: (a) the applicant fails to satisfy the applicable eligibility, legal, or technical requirements;

texts.orig: (18)  An international organisation or a foreign entity operating in Ghana may apply for access to the National Data Exchange Platform through the Authority. Applications for foreign data consumers shall be subject to additional conditions prescribed by the Authority, and must be approved by the Minister.
texts.text: An international organisation or a foreign entity operating in Ghana may apply for access to the National Data Exchange Platform through the Authority. Applications for foreign data consumers shall be subject to additional conditions prescribed by the Authority, and must be approved by the Minister.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The Authority shall submit a list of all foreign data consumer applications that have satisfied the prescribed additional criteria to the Minister for final approval on a quarterly basis.

texts.orig: Onboarding and Access Control Protocols
texts.text: Onboarding and Access Control Protocols

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 17. (1) The Authority shall establish a process for onboarding data consumers which may include the payment of any applicable onboarding or service fees.
texts.text: (1) The Authority shall establish a process for onboarding data consumers which may include the payment of any applicable onboarding or service fees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Authority shall implement access control protocols to govern the scope and level of access granted to each data consumer.
texts.text: The Authority shall implement access control protocols to govern the scope and level of access granted to each data consumer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A data consumer shall not access any database or transmit data beyond the level or purpose for which access has been granted. The Authority may suspend or revoke access for any data consumers who fail to comply with this section.
texts.text: A data consumer shall not access any database or transmit data beyond the level or purpose for which access has been granted. The Authority may suspend or revoke access for any data consumers who fail to comply with this section.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Data consumers who contravene subsection (3) commit an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.
texts.text: Data consumers who contravene subsection (3) commit an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than fifty thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Cross-Border Transfers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18. (1) The transfer of public interest data through the National Data Exchange Platform to data consumers outside the jurisdiction of Ghana is permitted only in accordance with the provisions of this Act.
texts.text: (1) The transfer of public interest data through the National Data Exchange Platform to data consumers outside the jurisdiction of Ghana is permitted only in accordance with the provisions of this Act.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)  Cross-border transfers pursuant to subsection (1) shall:
texts.text: (2)  Cross-border transfers pursuant to subsection (1) shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  be in compliance with the [Data Protection Act, 20XX(Act XXX)] and other applicable laws;
texts.text: (a)  be in compliance with the [Data Protection Act, 20XX(Act XXX)] and other applicable laws;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  comply with any safeguards, protocols or limitations prescribed under this Act or issued by the Authority; and
texts.text: (b)  comply with any safeguards, protocols or limitations prescribed under this Act or issued by the Authority; and

texts.text: (c)  be approved by the Minister.

texts.text: Safeguards under subsection (2) may include:

texts.text: (c)  limitations on the duration of access;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  additional requirements for technical safeguards, access logs and audits; and
texts.text: (d)  additional requirements for technical safeguards, access logs and audits; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  any safeguards prescribed by the Minister or the Authority.
texts.text: (e)  any safeguards prescribed by the Minister or the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A data provider or data consumer that facilitates or permits cross-border transfers of data through the National Data Exchange Platform in a manner that circumvents or violates this section, commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than one hundred thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A data provider or data consumer that facilitates or permits cross-border transfers of data through the National Data Exchange Platform in a manner that circumvents or violates this section, commits an offence and shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred penalty units and not more than one hundred thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The Authority may, in addition to the penalty under subsection (4), impose other administrative sanctions, including an administrative penalty of up to five thousand penalty units.
texts.text: The Authority may, in addition to the penalty under subsection (4), impose other administrative sanctions, including an administrative penalty of up to five thousand penalty units.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Protection
texts.text: Data Protection

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Subject Rights
texts.text: Data Subject Rights

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 19. Nothing in this Act shall be construed to limit or derogate from the rights of data subjects under the [Data Protection Act, 20XX (Act XXX)]. Where public interest data includes personal data, the processing, access, or sharing of such data through the National Data Exchange Platform shall be undertaken in a manner that upholds Act XXX. The Authority shall work in collaboration with the Data Protection Commission to ensure the enforcement of data subject rights in relation to the use, re-use and exchange of personal data through the National Data Exchange Platform.
texts.text: Nothing in this Act shall be construed to limit or derogate from the rights of data subjects under the [Data Protection Act, 20XX (Act XXX)]. Where public interest data includes personal data, the processing, access, or sharing of such data through the National Data Exchange Platform shall be undertaken in a manner that upholds Act XXX. The Authority shall work in collaboration with the Data Protection Commission to ensure the enforcement of data subject rights in relation to the use, re-use and exchange of personal data through the National Data Exchange Platform.

texts.orig: 21. (1) The Authority shall establish and maintain a monitoring system to monitor compliance with the rules, obligations and requirements of the National Data Exchange Platform and this Act.
texts.text: (1) The Authority shall establish and maintain a monitoring system to monitor compliance with the rules, obligations and requirements of the National Data Exchange Platform and this Act.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The Authority may appoint inspectors to carry out monitoring functions outlined under this Act or prescribed by the Authority or the Minister.

texts.text: The inspector may at reasonable times:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  enter and inspect a premises, which the inspector knows or reasonably suspects to be used for a purpose to which this Act applies, to ensure that the provisions of this Act are complied with; or
texts.text: (a)  enter and inspect a premises, which the inspector knows or reasonably suspects to be used for a purpose to which this Act applies, to ensure that the provisions of this Act are complied with; or

texts.text: (1) Where requested by the Authority, a participating institution shall provide reports on activities undertaken through the National Data Exchange Platform. The report shall include any information as may be prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A participating institution shall notify the Authority within seven days of any change in the information that was submitted to the Authority for approval as a participating institution.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Offences and Penalties
texts.text: Offences and Penalties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 23. (1) A person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act commits an offence and, where no penalty is expressly provided, shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than two hundred penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than two years or both.
texts.text: (1) A person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act commits an offence and, where no penalty is expressly provided, shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than two hundred penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than two years or both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) A person who fails to comply with an administrative sanction prescribed by the Authority under section 24 of this Act commits an offence and, where no penalty is expressly provided, shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than two hundred penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than two years or both.
texts.text: A person who fails to comply with an administrative sanction prescribed by the Authority under section 24 of this Act commits an offence and, where no penalty is expressly provided, shall be liable upon summary conviction to a fine of not less than two hundred penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than two years or both.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Where an offence under this Act is committed by a body corporate or by a member of a partnership or other firm, every director or officer of that body corporate or a member of the partnership or any other person concerned with the management of the firm shall be deemed to have committed that offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine or term of imprisonment as prescribed.
texts.text: Where an offence under this Act is committed by a body corporate or by a member of a partnership or other firm, every director or officer of that body corporate or a member of the partnership or any other person concerned with the management of the firm shall be deemed to have committed that offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine or term of imprisonment as prescribed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A person shall not be convicted of an offence under subsection (3) if it is proved that:
texts.text: A person shall not be convicted of an offence under subsection (3) if it is proved that:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  due diligence was exercised to prevent the commission of the offence; and
texts.text: (a)  due diligence was exercised to prevent the commission of the offence; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  the offence was committed without the knowledge, consent or connivance of that person.
texts.text: (b)  the offence was committed without the knowledge, consent or connivance of that person.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Administrative Sanctions
texts.text: Administrative Sanctions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24. (1) A person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act which is not designated as an offence may be liable to administrative sanctions as prescribed by the Authority.
texts.text: (1) A person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act which is not designated as an offence may be liable to administrative sanctions as prescribed by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Authority may prescribe the following sanctions:
texts.text: The Authority may prescribe the following sanctions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  issue a warning or non-compliance notice to a participating institution;
texts.text: (a)  issue a warning or non-compliance notice to a participating institution;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  suspend a participating institution from use of the National Data Exchange Platform;
texts.text: (b)  suspend a participating institution from use of the National Data Exchange Platform;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c)  revoke access and remove a participating institution from the National Data Exchange Platform;
texts.text: (c)  revoke access and remove a participating institution from the National Data Exchange Platform;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  impose administrative penalties on a participating institution;
texts.text: (d)  impose administrative penalties on a participating institution;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e)  impose bans on a participating institution; and
texts.text: (e)  impose bans on a participating institution; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f)  any other sanction as may be appropriate to redress the stated noncompliance.
texts.text: (f)  any other sanction as may be appropriate to redress the stated noncompliance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A participating institution that has its access or approval revoked may submit a fresh application to the Authority to be reinstated after rectifying the breach or non-compliance.
texts.text: A participating institution that has its access or approval revoked may submit a fresh application to the Authority to be reinstated after rectifying the breach or non-compliance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Participating institutions that have been banned shall not be permitted to reapply for access.
texts.text: Participating institutions that have been banned shall not be permitted to reapply for access.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The imposition of administrative sanctions or fines under this Act shall be without prejudice to any penalties, fines or sanctions that may be imposed by any other regulatory authority under any other enactment.
texts.text: The imposition of administrative sanctions or fines under this Act shall be without prejudice to any penalties, fines or sanctions that may be imposed by any other regulatory authority under any other enactment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  Where the conduct of a person constitutes an offence under this Act and any other enactment, nothing in this Act shall prevent the institution of proceedings under that other enactment.
texts.text: Where the conduct of a person constitutes an offence under this Act and any other enactment, nothing in this Act shall prevent the institution of proceedings under that other enactment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Dispute Resolution
texts.text: Dispute Resolution

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 25. (1)The Authority shall establish a dispute resolution process to resolve disputes:
texts.text: (1)The Authority shall establish a dispute resolution process to resolve disputes:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a)  between data providers and data consumers;
texts.text: (a)  between data providers and data consumers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b)  between or among different data providers;
texts.text: (b)  between or among different data providers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) between data subjects and data providers or data consumers; and
texts.text: (c) between data subjects and data providers or data consumers; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d)  between the Authority and data providers, data consumers or data subjects.
texts.text: (d)  between the Authority and data providers, data consumers or data subjects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Where a dispute, pursuant to subsections (c) and (d) above, concerns a matter involving data subjects, their personal data and data subject rights, then the Authority shall involve the Data Protection [Commission/Authority] in the resolution of the dispute.
texts.text: Where a dispute, pursuant to subsections (c) and (d) above, concerns a matter involving data subjects, their personal data and data subject rights, then the Authority shall involve the Data Protection [Commission/Authority] in the resolution of the dispute.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Where a dispute under subsection (1) involves matters pertaining to issues of cybersecurity, then the Authority shall involve the Cybersecurity Authority in the resolution of the dispute.
texts.text: Where a dispute under subsection (1) involves matters pertaining to issues of cybersecurity, then the Authority shall involve the Cybersecurity Authority in the resolution of the dispute.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Any one or more parties to a dispute may refer the dispute to the Authority for settlement by any alternative dispute resolution mechanism.
texts.text: Any one or more parties to a dispute may refer the dispute to the Authority for settlement by any alternative dispute resolution mechanism.

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (a)  the dispute resolution committee established under section 26; or

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (b)  any alternative dispute resolution mechanism

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: the parties shall not institute an action in court until the dispute resolution procedure has been exhausted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 26. (1) The Authority shall establish a Dispute Resolution Committee for the purpose of the resolution of disputes and shall prescribe the rules of procedure of the Dispute Resolution Committee.
texts.text: (1) The Authority shall establish a Dispute Resolution Committee for the purpose of the resolution of disputes and shall prescribe the rules of procedure of the Dispute Resolution Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The composition of the Dispute Resolution Committee shall be determined by the board of the Authority in consultation with the Advisory Committee.
texts.text: The composition of the Dispute Resolution Committee shall be determined by the board of the Authority in consultation with the Advisory Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Dispute Resolution Committee shall expeditiously investigate and hear any matter which is brought before it.
texts.text: The Dispute Resolution Committee shall expeditiously investigate and hear any matter which is brought before it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Authority shall determine the period within which disputes may be settled.
texts.text: The Authority shall determine the period within which disputes may be settled.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The Dispute Resolution Committee may require evidence or arguments to be presented in writing and may decide the matters upon which it will hear oral evidence or written arguments.
texts.text: The Dispute Resolution Committee may require evidence or arguments to be presented in writing and may decide the matters upon which it will hear oral evidence or written arguments.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: A party to a dispute may appear at the hearing and may be represented by a lawyer or another person of that person's choice.

texts.text: Powers of the Dispute Resolution Committee

texts.text: (1) The Dispute Resolution Committee shall have the power to:

Restricted Data includes state secrets, information relating to national security, confidential business information, or other categories that the law exempts from public disclosure.
